node.title: Booster vaccine time frames to be reviewed as COVID-19 Omicron variant appears in Australia
node.alt: A man in a suit stands in front of a lectern speaking, a blue curtain is behind him.
node.description: Health Minister Greg Hunt has asked the government's expert immunisation panel to review the time frameÂ for when Australians should have a COVID-19 booster shot.
node.content: ["Health Minister Greg Hunt has asked the government's expert immunisation panel to review the time frame\u00a0for COVID-19 booster shots, after the detection of the Omicron \"variant of concern\" in Australia.", "The\u00a0Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation's (ATAGI) current advice for the booster shot\u00a0is that it be administered six months after a person has received their second dose.", "Mr Hunt said Australian vaccine supplies were ready if ATAGI recommended\u00a0a shorter booster time frame.", "\"We will, as ever, allow them (ATAGI) to act independently and continue to follow their advice,\" Mr Hunt said.", "\"But we're prepared with supplies. We are already one of the earliest nations in the world, after Israel, to have\u00a0a whole-of-nation booster program.", "\"If they recommend changes, we will follow those changes.\"", "Mr Hunt said 415,000 people had so far received booster shots, out of an eligible cohort of about 500,000.", "Two cases of the Omicron variant were confirmed in NSW yesterday, and NSW Health authorities are conducting urgent genomic testing to determine whether another two people who arrived from southern Africa last night have the Omicron COVID-19 variant.", "The federal government on Saturday announced that non-Australian citizens who had\u00a0been in nine countries in southern Africa where Omicron had\u00a0been detected were barred from entering Australia.", "Mr Hunt said the government would not hesitate to take additional measures if required, but the government's aim was to \"remain safely open\".", "\"We're in a vastly different position\u00a0from where we were on February 1, 2020,\" Mr Hunt said.", "\"We are one of the most highly\u00a0vaccinated, one of the most recently\u00a0vaccinated, and one of the first to\u00a0commence a whole-of-nation booster\u00a0program from around the world.\"", "He also urged calm, as he noted that early evidence suggested symptoms caused by the Omicron variant appeared to be mild.", "The Chief Medical Officer said there was no evidence yet that vaccines were less effective against the Omicron variant.", "More to come."]
